revised_title: Observations on Glandular Liver and Fluid Accumulation
tldr: In this letter, John Brown describes a unique case of a soldier's liver that appeared glandular to the eye. The patient suffered from fluid accumulation, and Brown performed a paracenthesis to drain the excess fluid. Upon the patient's death, the liver was dissected, revealing glandular structures containing a yellowish ichor. This observation supports the opinion of Malpighius and highlights the importance of further study of the liver's glandular structures.
